subject: all elements on `develop` target @next releases
header: feat: all elements on `develop` target @next releases
body:
To allow us to build a `preview` version of the elements, we release
`next` versions of `pie-elements` on each push to `develop`. This branch
should in turn target any other preview packages (aka @pie-ui/*).

When we merge to master, a `pre-push` hooks prevents us from pushing if
we haven't resolved all the `next` versions.

* use babel 7
* use build-helper `Commands`

subject: partial scoring logic updated to use pairwise combinations [ch440]
header: feat: partial scoring logic updated to use pairwise combinations [ch440]
body:
* `partialScoring`: [{correctCount: number, weight: number}] is gone
* `partialScoring` is now a boolean (partialScoring defaults to true).
* uses pairwise combinations to calculate the partial score
footer:
BREAKING CHANGE: `question.partialScoring` is no longer a set of rules
with weights. It's now a boolean.

notes.title: BREAKING CHANGE
notes.text:
`question.partialScoring` is no longer a set of rules
with weights. It's now a boolean.

subject: UI and model updates [ch423]
body:
* Updated design
* Removed `moveOnDrag` for a choice individually
*  added `removeTilesAfterPlacing` property on the entire list of choices.

subject: scoring change [ch440]
body:
* by default duplicates are not allowed
* this can be overridden by `question.configure.removeTilesAfterPlacing`
* by default the answer must be 'complete' aka the length must match the
correct response length.

subject: `orderMustBeComplete` defaults to false
body:
> Note: this should really be a breaking change as it changes the
results of identical functions, but going to leave that as we haven't
done a full release yet.

footer: BREAKING CHANGE: `model.configure` is removed, use `configuration` instead.

subject: Session null/empty check.
body: Check for each interaction if: has outcome function, outcome function returns { score: 0, empty: true } if session null/empty/undefined, everywhere where session is used we handle if session is null/empty/undefined and test each function that uses session. [match-list, match, math-inline, multiple-choice, number-line, placement-ordering, point-intercept, select-text, text-entry]
